_comment: Created by ianb on 08/10/2013 13:52:19 using v0.9
title: How have the average waiting times for diagnostic tests changed?
analysis_commentary: The median time it took for a diagnostic test has decreased over time and again we see the impact of the introduction of the six-week target in March 2008. We also see a spike in the median diagnosis time in each September, this is most likely due to the summer effect, where people are unable to attend appointments for diagnosis in July/August.
